programme.title: Britain's War of Thrones: The Hundred Years War, with Dan Jones
programme.desc: Dan Jones, writer, historian and consultant on Knightfall, continues his exploration of the Hundred Years War, recalling the epic story of the rival dynasties that forged the history of medieval and early modern Europe.

programme.title: Pirate Traders
programme.desc: Armed with a crew for protection, Tony heads to a shady area of the Dominican Republic to check out a tug boat he might be able to buy for a steal.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: Roy brings along Bogart's sisters to try and throw him off at the auction. Meanwhile, Ursula is in a bad mood and the others try to take advantage.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: Ursula is in need of a change of luck with her shop suffering from poor sales, while Rick and Cindy argue about marriage.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: A tense season takes its toll on the hunters, with one veteran spraying his partner with bullet fragments. Elsewhere, a conflict between brothers nearly comes to violence.

programme.title: Monster Croc Wrangler
programme.desc: Documentary detailing the work of Matt Wright, the helicoptor pilot who became a wildlife conservationist specialising in saltwater crocodiles.

programme.title: Monster Croc Wrangler
programme.desc: Matt Wright works to clear crocodiles from his friend Paul's cattle station. However, with giant lizards lurking at every turn, the wrangler realises he may be in for a long job.

programme.title: Monster Croc Wrangler
programme.desc: Part one of two. Matt Wright is called in to remove a large crocodile and a handful of smaller reptiles from a cattle station, but a monsoon is fast approaching.

programme.title: Monster Croc Wrangler
programme.desc: Part two of two. The giant crocodile Matt Wright has been hunting evades his traps again, and it becomes clear this massive predator is going to push the wrangler to his limits.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Frank and Mike talk their way into a salvage yard that has not been picked over for decades.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: The posse meet three cat clerics who worship Lister. Lister vows to help them as they're being hunted by a feral cat leader who wants to wipe out cats who worship anyone but him. Ray Fearon joins the regular cast as the ruthless Rodon, leader of the feral cats, with Tom Bennett, Mandeep Dhillon and Lucy Pearman as the cat clerics.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Terms and Conditions Apply
programme.desc: Using his trademark, powerpoint-comedy and a series of mischievous games, Dave invites three of the country's finest comic minds to help him make sense of our insensible world. In the first episode he is joined by Richard Osman, Phil Wang and Sara Barron, as they take a deep dive into the details we usually miss.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Actress and comedy writer Jennifer Saunders takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from November 2018, with artist Grayson Perry and stand-up Matt Forde joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts an extended edition of the comedy panel show, in which correctness and even intelligence go out of the window, in favour of answers the host finds most interesting. This time, Sandi Toksvig, Aisling Bea, Susan Calman and regular panellist Alan Davies navigate the topic of mathematics.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis front a special edition of the topical comedy show featuring best bits and unseen material from the series.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Tim Warwood and Adam Gendle attempt to come up with a next level surfboard to add to the Hawaiian's history book.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: Steve Austin's Broken Skull Challenge
programme.desc: The former wrestler challenges eight contestants to triumph over a series of gruelling physical endurance tests.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve and a team of kayakers head to the Himalayas to visit the last great unexplored river in Bhutan. Legend has it that at some point, the river drops off the face of the planet.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Presenters Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May are challenged to build a bridge over the River Kwai in Thailand. In order to do that, however, they have to drive across Burma, a country that has been largely closed to Westerners for more than 40 years, and must make the trip in three lorries, each bought sight unseen from the internet on a limited budget. What follows is an epic journey of beautiful scenery, regular adversity, ongoing malfunction and the constant bickering of the three men.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Freddie Flintoff heads to Iceland to compete in the world's maddest motorsport, while Paddy McGuinness gets to grips with the latest Toyota Supra. Chris Harris investigates the story of the Lotus 79, arguably the most beautiful F1 car of all time.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the international event from London's Alexandra Palace in which amateur drivers race home-made, engineers vehicles. Over the years, vehicles have ranged from a piano to a giant baby carriage, and the latest contenders include C-17 Roadmaster, Braking Badly, Poldark Express and Turbo Tugboat.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner returns with the light-hearted panel show in which three celebrities argue the case for having their pet hates banished for ever to the fictional room. In the opening show, the big names with an even bigger axe to grind are one-time Doctor Who and Broadchurch star David Tennant, veteran broadcaster Trevor McDonald, and actress, writer and comedian Aisling Bea. Sushi, flossing, pigeons, lateness and queuing are just some of the things that get this trio's backs up - but who will Frank decide has made the most persuasive argument?.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Comedian Noel Fielding, footballer-turned-presenter Ian Wright and actress Joanna Scanlan reveal their pet hates to Frank Skinner in the hope he will banish them to Room 101. Things that really get on the guests' nerves this week include spiders, stinky cheese, hangovers and bad toast etiquette.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Model Katie Price, comedian Greg Davies and Citizen Khan star Adil Ray tell Frank Skinner what really gets on their wick, in the hope he will banish their bugbears to the infamous room for ever. The celebrities' gripes include friends who give their dog specific instructions and talentless people on talent shows.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: The weird and wonderful compete in an extreme downhill battle in Cincinnati, Ohio, but who will be victorious?.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Paddy McGuiness, Chris Harris and Freddie Flintoff go on a road trip in a trio of affordable second-hand convertibles. On the test track, Chris puts the new Ariel Atom through its paces, while Freddie goes bungee jumping off a dam in an old Rover.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve and a team of kayakers head to the Himalayas to visit the last great unexplored river in Bhutan. Legend has it that at some point, the river drops off the face of the planet.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Actress and comedy writer Jennifer Saunders takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from November 2018, with artist Grayson Perry and stand-up Matt Forde joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts an extended edition of the comedy panel show, in which correctness and even intelligence go out of the window, in favour of answers the host finds most interesting. This time, Sandi Toksvig, Aisling Bea, Susan Calman and regular panellist Alan Davies navigate the topic of mathematics.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Henning Wehn, Lucy Porter, Guz Khan
programme.desc: Henning Wehn hosts from London's Hammersmith Apollo, welcoming Lucy Porter and Guz Khan to the stage.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Heavy haulage experts Ian Bagladi and Jamie Turnbull need to move a classical but abandoned 63-year-old, 70-tonne locomotive, through the English countryside.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The Falkirk wheel is the first and only rotating boat lift, capable of moving 600 tonnes of boat and water over a 25-metre height difference in just minutes.

programme.title: Medieval Murder Mysteries
programme.sub-title: The Princes in The Tower: Royal Blood
programme.desc: Examining the case of the princes in the tower, and questioning whether or not Richard III ordered their deaths.

programme.title: Medieval Murder Mysteries
programme.sub-title: Amy Dudley: The Queen, Her Lover, and His Wife
programme.desc: The suspicious death of Elizabethan noblewoman Amy Dudley, the wife of Robert Dudley, the favourite and alleged lover of Queen Elizabeth I and the man the monarch is said to have wanted to marry - if only he had been available. Amy's body was found at the foot of the stairs at Cumnor Place, her home in Oxfordshire in 1560, and her death caused a scandal - with the finger of blame pointed firmly at Dudley.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Churchills
programme.desc: Historian David Starkey profiles two of Britain's greatest wartime leaders. He begins by revealing how Winston Churchill came to write a biography of his ancestor John, who led the nation against Louis XIV of France. Starkey also explores how preparations for the Second World War were affected by the prime minister's knowledge of his 17th-century forebear's achievements.

programme.title: The Churchills
programme.desc: Historian David Starkey explains how writing a biography of his ancestor John, the first Duke of Marlborough, changed the way Winston Churchill was seen by the public and politicians, and so paved the way for his return to power. The first volume, published in 1933, reinforced the perception of him as a man past his time. But it was the second instalment, depicting John Churchill's march to the Danube and victory at Blenheim, which began to mark out Winston as the only leading politician who truly knew war.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The months following prime minister Neville Chamberlain's declaration of war against Germany, in which the only casualties on the home front were those who had to endure the blackouts. Elsewhere in Europe, the Nazi war machine cut a swathe of destruction. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How, in 1940, the French Army suffered a heavy defeat after underestimating the Nazis' strength while relying on First World War strategies and equipment to defend its frontiers. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The drop in morale of Churchill's forces following the fall of France to Nazi forces during the Second World War, and how the Dunkirk evacuation and the Battle of Britain helped to restore British confidence. Plus, America's reasons for initially refusing to enter the conflict.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: An account of Hitler's decision to invade the Soviet Union, which produced an initial series of dazzling victories until the harsh winter of 1941 took hold, with fatal consequences for the ill-equipped German army. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Laurence Olivier narrates this documentary chronicling events leading up to the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbour on December 7, 1941, and the subsequent collapse of unprepared British forces before the advancing enemy in Singapore. Includes interviews with veterans from both sides.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A delightful collection of British classics comes up for auction, including an Austin A35 and a Hillman Avenger Estate in stunning condition. An E-Type Jaguar also hits the auction.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Three MGs from the 70s turn up at the garage, still covered in original factory wax. Nobody can believe it, or value them. A Morris 1000 turns up at the auction along with a TR7 V8.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Three rare Alvises get the auction buyers going when put under the hammer. A Chevy Corvette which started its journey in Saudi Arabia makes its way to Thornton le Dale for the sale.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Dave gets a nasty surprise when he opens the bonnet of a fast Ford from the 80's, and an Austin Heavy 12 nearly a century old sets off a bidding war at the auction.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek, with help from the Mathewson clan, drag a mini pickup out of the barn where it's been for 20 years, and a 350cc Douglas Mark V motorbike from 1950 goes under the hammer.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Four VW camper vans pitch up at the auction house looking for a new home and Derek picks up an Austin 16 that 'goes like stink and has some unusual modern modifications'.

programme.title: Saluting Dad's Army
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong celebrates the genius and impact of enduring classic BBC sitcom Dad's Army paying tribute to those who created it. From the very first conversation and the true stories that inspired the series, through to its long-standing legacy, he revisits the entire history of the seminal sitcom. Using archive footage and newly captured interviews, the series offers a true insight into how Dad's Army became not just a TV hit, but an institution.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Michelle takes advantage of the fact that the Germans think Rene is dead, planning for him to go to England to help the British win the war.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: As Michelle makes arrangements to send a microfilm to England by homing pigeon, Herr Flick captures Yvette and Mimi in order to gain access to the cafe to search for the painting of the Fallen Madonna. However, the town's annual Fishmongers' Parade proves a hindrance for all concerned. Gordon Kaye and Kirsten Cooke star.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Rene and the others make the final preparations for the parade, while the general, the colonel and Gruber play a round of golf, during which they discuss the plot to blow up Hitler.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of a North Yorkshire-based, family-run historic car auction business, which uncovers some remarkably rare vehicles in the picturesque village of Thornton-le-Dale.

programme.title: History Hunters
programme.desc: The team acquire a personalised Victorian pistol and try to track down the original owner. A customer brings in brasses that his dad brought back from the Somme.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: The parents of a teenage murder victim ask Kavanagh to pursue a private prosecution on their behalf and he promptly agrees, despite the fact they are unemployed and unable to pay a fee. The accused is related to a powerful local crook, and finding witnesses prepared to testify proves no easy task. John Thaw stars, with Lisa Harrow and Nicholas Jones.

programme.title: Trial & Retribution
programme.desc: Fifteen-year-old Cassie Booth goes missing while doing her local paper round, and her blood-stained clothes are later found in a nearby boathouse owned by Karl Wilding. He is the prime suspect, but then seemingly helpful Stephen Warrington, a wine merchant who has initially brought a complaint about a house being used as a brothel, demonstrates too much interest in the case.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the stunning Rowden Gardens on Dartmoor - one of the participants in the National Gardens Scheme.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: One Step Too Far - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. Laura looks at Gabriel with new eyes when he takes a surprisingly compassionate approach to her wayward son Liam, who is being bullied because of her job. Adam tries to mend fences with the rank-and-file officers by going out on the beat with June - only to lose his cool completely when a traffic accident triggers painful memories. Samantha jeopardises Jo's investigation by poaching her informant, leading to a bitter row, while Gary's future on the force looks uncertain after he reacts to Suzie's constant needling with a very public outburst.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: One Step Too Far - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. Laura begins to feel increasingly unfulfilled in her role as PCSO, and announces to Smithy that she wants to become a PC. Gina's old flame Jonathan Fox returns to Sun Hill, and Neil pressures Gary to drop his bullying accusations against Susie Sim. Gabriel warns an increasingly infatuated Sheelagh not to get involved with him, while Samantha continues to needle Jo, fuelling an already volatile situation.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Zain Nadir searches for a missing 14-year-old whose online romance has led her into danger, and a guilt-stricken Gabriel reveals to Sheelagh that he deliberately killed the Sun Hill sniper by pushing him from a rooftop. Meanwhile, Honey returns to work after the shock suicide of murderous husband Scott, and finds herself paired with arch-enemy Amber Johannsen. True to form, it isn't long before they come to blows.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Zain Nadir discovers Smithy has been canoodling with the wife of notorious local gangster Pete Larson, while arch-rivals Amber and Honey are teamed up yet again, this time to catch a gang defrauding cash machines. June has another bash at warning Sheelagh against getting too involved with Gabriel, and Phil is livid to discover ex-lover Christine is planning on emigrating to Australia - taking their daughter Madison with her.

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Detective Inspector Henry Crabbe prepares for his retirement and the opening of his restaurant - but the police force seems reluctant to let him go. First episode of the crime drama, starring Richard Griffiths and Maggie Steed.

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Henry is enlisted in the search for a missing policeman, but the restaurant's opening night is looming. Detective drama, starring Richard Griffiths and Maggie Steed.

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice
programme.desc: Andrew Davies' adaptation of Jane Austen's classic novel, starring Colin Firth, Jennifer Ehle, Alison Steadman, Benjamin Whitrow and Julia Sawalha. A wealthy eligible bachelor rents a property in Hertfordshire, causing a flurry of anticipation among the ladies of the district. However, it transpires he also brought along a friend - the haughty and aloof Fitzwilliam Darcy.

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice
programme.desc: Mrs Bennet spots an opportunity to marry off another of her daughters with the arrival of clergyman Mr Collins. However, Elizabeth is unable to take his proposal seriously, being too preoccupied with a handsome newcomer who poisons her mind further against Mr Darcy. Alison Steadman, Jennifer Ehle and David Bamber star in Andrew Davies' adaptation of Jane Austen's classic novel.

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice
programme.desc: Elizabeth visits Mr Collins once Charlotte has accepted his proposal of marriage and confides in Jane that she regards him as one of the stupidest men in England. Mrs Bennet sizes up George Wickham as a potential suitor for her daughter - but he has set his heart on society heiress Miss King.

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice
programme.desc: Rejected by Elizabeth, Darcy decides to return to Rosling Park - and resolves to reveal the truth about Wickham's character in a letter. Colin Firth, Jennifer Ehle, Alison Steadman, Benjamin Whitrow and Julia Sawalha star.

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice
programme.desc: Despite Miss Bingley's efforts to keep them apart, Darcy and Elizabeth's relationship grows more affectionate - until bad news arrives from Longbourn about Lydia and Wickham. Jane Austen adaptation, starring Jennifer Ehle, Colin Firth and Julia Sawalha.

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice
programme.desc: Wickham's elopement with Lydia makes Elizabeth see him for what he really is, while Bingley proposes to Jane - an offer she readily accepts. Colin Firth and Jennifer Ehle star.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The nuns and midwives return home after their trip to South Africa, to find Nonnatus House has come under new management. The formidable Sister Ursula (Harriet Walter) has taken charge and introduced some drastic changes to the way the clinic is run, which Sister Julienne, bound by her vow of obedience, is powerless to oppose. The midwives come to the aid of a victim of domestic violence whose husband is about to be released from prison, and who risks losing everything if she seeks a divorce. Sister Mary Cynthia suffers further anxiety attacks, and Patsy receives distressing news about her father.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: The owner and curator of Brokenwood's Historic Village, Charity Highmore-Browne, dies after being struck by an arrow. Mike and his team delve into the realm of New Zealand's colonial past as they deal with suspects including a blacksmith, a missionary, the local postmaster and the victim's sister. Neill Rea stars.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Two long-dead bodies are found in a disused coal mine on the outskirts of Glasgow when it is reopened to serve as the central attraction for a museum. Investigations reveal the pair had been involved in violent encounters just before their deaths, and the search to discover their identities uncovers deeply buried resentments in the community. Detective drama, starring Alex Norton, Blythe Duff and John Michie.

programme.title: Crank (2006)
programme.desc: An assassin faces a race against time when he learns a rival has poisoned him with a drug that will kill him if his heart rate drops below a certain level. As he sets out to take revenge on his enemies, he has to resort to increasingly desperate acts to keep his adrenaline pumping. Action thriller, with Jason Statham, Amy Smart and Jose Pablo Cantillo.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Babushka
programme.desc: Game show hosted by Rylan Clark-Neal in which contestants answer questions to get the chance to open a set of giant Russian nesting dolls, with some empty and others containing prizes up to 10,000

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Mission Employable
programme.desc: Agent Kym takes on the challenges of a farmhand and discovers that there are lots of jobs to do there. For her first job of the day, she has to feed the calves.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Weasel tries for his AeroFizz pilot's license. Magoo ruins everything when, convinced he's fixing his roof, he pierces a hole in the airship..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz and Weasel shoot people with toy arrows to make them fall in love with Fizz. But Magoo mistakes them for a giant hornet..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz rehearses a dance number that'll make him a star. But when Weasel catapults him next door onto the roof, Magoo thinks he's a stray alien.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean digs up Bruiser Snr's medallion and rushes off to the local museum convinced he's found treasure..

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean pimps his car in order to prove to Declan - a rival in love - that Bean's car is better..

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: After an overpass collapses on the highway, Team Tennyson is in a traffic jam along with Simon Sez and family.

programme.title: The Epic Tales of Captain Underpants
programme.sub-title: Captain Underpants and the Horrible Hostilities of the Homework Hydra
programme.desc: Can George and Harold destroy homework by making sure it was never invented in the first place?.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: George takes the Spuds to the museum of mouldy cheese. Anna dares Dave to lick the cheeses on display..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Dave rescues an endangered donkey from the docks. Hiding it in the camper van, things take a turn when the donkey eats Gran's glasses.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: This time, the chef travels to south Wales, where he is accompanied by Michelin-starred chef Stephen Terry. James cooks a Welsh lamb ragu on a beautiful mountainside, and samples award-winning Welsh wine and organic Welsh chocolate. Later, he visits Shaun Hill at his renowned restaurant, The Walnut Tree.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott's culinary tour reaches North Africa and the Moroccan city of Marrakesh. He visits a restaurant famous for cooking whole lambs in an underground oven, has a masterclass from local chef Cedric, who shows him how to make traditional food with a fancy twist, and hits the main square for some street food. Throughout the show he prepares flat breads with tomato salsa, barbecue corn on the cob with local spice spicy ras el hanout and whole fish with chermoula.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner prepare potato curry, rhubarb crumble and asparagus with Hollandaise. Gino D'Acampo cooks chicken in beer in Sardinia and The Great British Bake Off's Jane Beedle demonstrates a gluten-free roulade.

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the 14th series of nationwide talent search, which sees a wide variety of acts, from comedians to contortionists, singers to spoon players, compete for the chance to win 250,000 and a coveted slot at the Royal Variety Performance. Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and David Walliams are once again on hand to judge this week's applicants, and each of them has the chance to put their favourite contestant straight through to the live semi-finals by awarding them the Golden Buzzer.

programme.title: Twister (1996)
programme.desc: A storm-chaser and her estranged husband are brought together in a joint project to monitor the path of an oncoming tornado - but the pair face a race against the clock as a rival government-backed group with hi-tech resources tries to beat them to it. Action thriller, starring Helen Hunt, Bill Paxton, Cary Elwes, Jami Gertz and Philip Seymour Hoffman.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which members of a baseball team from Newport answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge. They then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: Ben Shephard invites music legend Tito Jackson, actress Faye Brookes (Corrie's Kate Connor) and Good Morning Britain weather presenter Laura Tobin to take part in a special edition of the quiz show, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the better their chances of collecting the 20,000 prize for their selected charity.

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: In this edition, Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show from Swansea, setting members of the public unusual challenges for a chance to win anything from the price of their petrol to 1,000 in the big finale game.

programme.title: The Family Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents the game show in which four relatives team up - this week the Telfers from Milton Keynes - and pit their wits against one of the finest quiz brains in the country, in the hope of taking away thousands of pounds.

programme.title: The Good Karma Hospital
programme.desc: The team members are hit hard by a life-or-death emergency, forcing Gabriel to face his true feelings. Lydia's determination to help Jyoti get better comes at a great personal cost to the doctor. Ted seeks closure as he prepares to leave India. Medical drama, starring Amanda Redman, James Krishna Floyd, Kenneth Cranham and Sayani Gupta.

programme.title: Belgravia
programme.desc: The conclusion of Julian Fellowes' drama about secrets and lies in uptight 19th-century London society. James travels to Manchester to investigate the allegations made against Charles, but soon realises there are greater threats at play. Lady Templemore employs Reggie to make Lady Maria change her mind, but her daughter will not give in so easily. Susan is in danger of losing everything after her secret is revealed, but as ever she uses her cunning to twist the situation to her own and others' benefit, while Charles is puzzled to receive a mysterious olive branch. Keen to end the feuding, he seeks out the offer of reconciliation - unaware he is being lured into danger.

programme.title: Exposure
programme.desc: Jonathan Maitland presents an undercover report on the fast-growing sport of white-collar boxing, whereby people with little or no experience of fighting train to appear in special bouts, often for charity. Two undercover reporters attend training sessions at gyms in Leeds and London to find out how safe it is for those who take part.

programme.title: Ross Kemp: On the NHS Frontline
programme.desc: First of two programmes in which Ross Kemp follows frontline medical staff in Milton Keynes Hospital Trust as they prepare for and face the coronavirus pandemic. He witnesses the sacrifices staff and their families are making in their battle against the disease. And he follows the journey of patients admitted into the hospital's respiratory ward with mild symptoms, through to the intensive care units, where those with severe Covid-19 fight for their lives.

programme.title: You've Been Framed!
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates a comical selection of mishaps filmed by viewers. Highlights include a man accidentally throwing a hammer through his patio door, a young couple interrupted during a romantic proposal and a woman in labour who decides to play a prank on her midwife.

programme.title: Rewind The Party Classics
programme.desc: We're all about good times and good tunes! Get in the party mood as we rewind the ultimate party tunes to get you on the dancefloor.

programme.title: Late Night Magic
programme.desc: We're taking you all the way through the night with soem of the best tracks of all time.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Bushmen confront a miner who has illegally dug their claim. The Young Guns must find a new source of opal when poisonous fumes force them to abandon their mine.

programme.title: Stars in Their Cars
programme.desc: Actress Patsy Kensit revisits the glitz of London's nightlife in a German tourer and drives a legendary British motor similar to one she used to own.

programme.title: Stars in Their Cars
programme.desc: Model Jodie Kidd is reunited with the old banger she learned to drive in, liberates her Italian supercar from a museum and tales Britain's finest roadster to Goodwood.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini starts off the auction season in Amelia Island where he shows a rare Renault Jolly and helps to sell a 1988 Porsche 959 Sport.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: The Orange County Choppers team builds a vehicle for the Science Channel, and an accident at Paul Jr Designs prompts Paul Sr to put aside his differences with his sons.

programme.title: Airplane Repo
programme.desc: Mike Kennedy repos a chopper from the roof of a corporate high-rise, Kevin Lacey infiltrates a Mexican ranch, and Ken and Danny take on rival team.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe installs a lightning rod system on the roof of a house in Mississippi, but finds himself struggling to cope in the sweltering heat.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: Vibrating Mining Screens/Whoopie Pies/Utility Poles/Roller Conveyors
programme.desc: The development, manufacturing and distribution of vibrating mining screens, whoopie pies, wood utility poles and roller conveyors.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: How exercise bikes, Cornish pasties, pasta makers and slate products are made.

programme.title: Harvey Weinstein: ID Breaking Now
programme.desc: The crimes of former producer and convicted sex offender. Featuring a one-on-one with Ambra Gutierrez, the Italian model who wore a wire that captured audio that helped lead to Weinstein's conviction and sentencing.

programme.title: The Killer in My Family
programme.desc: Levi Bellfield's ex-partner reveals what life was like with the serial killer. Bellfield killed Milly Dowler in 2002, and was also responsible for at least three more deaths.

programme.title: The Killer in My Family
programme.desc: The sister-in-law and brother of Surjit Athwal talk about her murder in a so-called 'honour killing', discussing what went wrong and how two families were torn apart.

programme.title: The Killer in My Family
programme.desc: Phillip Fraser's daughter talks about the murderer, who killed his ex-wife in 1997, before stabbing another former partner to death while out on licence.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The story of an undercover operation, codenamed 'Safe Bet', which targeted corrupt police officers and their connections with the Chicago Mafia.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The team faces the difficult task of catching and transporting two emus to the Houston SPCA. A routine capture becomes an emergency rescue.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Veterinary surgeon Chris Brown hopes to find a new home for an orphaned Shih Tzu with a chronic ear problem.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Niki Ann arrives at the shop with a $5,000 budget, Dawn's mother turns up with something to help make shopping easier and Kristyn plans to wow her guests with her dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride's father hijacks her shopping trip, vetoing numerous dress options. Meanwhile, another woman clashes with her bridesmaids after an argument.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.sub-title: Say Yes to the Short Dress
programme.desc: A bride battles her 'Honorary Brides Man' for control of her dress, while a same-sex couple fight over picking a colour.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Marie wants to please her mother and brother, but her indecision mixes with their strong opinions, while Jamie leaves her dress decision to the toss of a coin.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Country girl Elizabeth admits she is more comfortable with hunting than dress shopping, while Christina's father does not respond well to a photo of his daughter in her dream dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Self-conscious Katie wonders whether her dream dress will fit, while Ivy's fiance insists she try on a gown that is four times her budget.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Lavina has walked down the aisle 15 times as a bridesmaid, and now it is finally her turn to be the bride, while staff member Jennifer makes a series of rookie mistakes.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Lacey has ballooned to over 600lbs and must now rally her divorced parents around her and find a way to modulate her moods that won't include binge-eating.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Updates on Liz, Jennifer and Marissa. Despite now being able to walk, old fears still hang over Liz. Jennifer and Marissa still cannot get along, especially when Jennifer takes back her ex.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Bedridden for four years, Penny knows her weight may kill her unless drastic actions are taken, and hopes to have a gastric bypass before it is too late.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Leah, a former model, is assigned to consultant Dianne, who is challenged by her opinionated maid-of-honour.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Debbie and Carmel team up to sell dresses to sister brides, but one of them would rather work alone.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A woman who lost her mother to breast cancer battles her opinionated aunt, while Ellen falls for a dress that might be beyond her means.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Julie and her mother cannot hold back when it comes to their brutal opinions, while brides-to-be Joy and Beth have high expectations.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A woman returns a ballroom-style dress so that she can buy one that better suits her edgy tastes.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Carmel desperately needs a sale to hit her monthly goal, while Keasha works with bride-to-be Heidi who recently donated a kidney to her fiance.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bre is set on a traditional gown, while Jennifer knows the exact dress for her. Elsewhere, Susan finally gets to make her dream wedding a reality after a 20-year wait.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Tiffany's choice of a hot pink gown is proving controversial with her mother, while second-time bride Holly attends her fitting.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa unexpectedly reads one of the construction workers in her home. Meanwhile, in a group reading, she converts a sceptic who lost his son in a car accident.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo claims she can speak to the dead, as she connects clients with their loved ones.

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive
programme.desc: Judy worries suspicious neighbours will have her house officially condemned by the authorities, and tries to begin the painful process of clearing out the accumulated items.

programme.title: Dead of Winter
programme.desc: After a blizzard, a son visits his parents, only to find them murdered. Does a peculiar local know what happened during the snowstorm?.

programme.title: 1000lb Sisters
programme.desc: Amy and Tammy go to Atlanta to meet Dr Procter to discuss weight-loss surgery. Tammy has a hefty weight loss goal, and the dietician has bad news for Amy.

programme.title: Dr G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: The doctor encounters a girl who claims contaminated well-water killed her father. Plus, a man dies after complaining of severely aching knees - did he overdose on pain relief - or was he ill?.
